metadata.Title: CVE-2018-17456 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Git before 2.14.5, 2.15.x before 2.15.3, 2.16.x before 2.16.5, 2.17.x before 2.17.2, 2.18.x before 2.18.1, and 2.19.x before 2.19.1 allows remote code execution during processing of a recursive "git clone" of a superproject if a .gitmodules file has a URL field beginning with a '-' character.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17456` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

git - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-all - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-arch - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-bzr - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-core - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-cvs - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-daemon-run - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-daemon-sysvinit - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-el - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-email - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-gui - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-man - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-mediawiki - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.9
git-svn - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.9
gitk - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.9
gitweb - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: git package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.9').
